CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 1, 1959, pg. 8, reads: "Ready for the Circus - The picture above shows one of the several groups of Third Ward adults and youngsters assembled in a vacant lot on Arthur St., last Friday evening, waiting for automobiles to take them to the Police Circus at Forbes Field. The circus party was paid for by the Checker Club, headed by J. Cephus Ford.  Members of the Uptown Club supplied automobiles to transport the guests who numbered over 300. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group of women, men, and children gathered in Arthur Street lot, awaiting cars provided by Checker Club to take them to the Police Circus at Forbes Field
